summary: The Two Prairies Ultra is an intimate, 'FAT ASS' style ultramarathon that takes runners through the heart of the Ocala National Forest in Fort McCoy, Florida. Participants traverse the scenic Juniper and Hopkins Prairies on the historic Florida Trail, experiencing a self-supported challenge that emphasizes community and a deep connection to the wilderness.
uniqueFeatures: Operates as a true 'FAT ASS' event with no registration fees, prioritizing a grassroots, self-supported running experience over commercial race perks.
The course features a unique double out-and-back format that explores the oldest and most scenic sections of the Florida Trail within the protected Juniper Wilderness.
Participation is strictly capped at just 50 runners to preserve the delicate wilderness environment and maintain the event's small-scale, community-focused atmosphere.

media.title: Two Prairies Ultra: Course Talk and Fat Ass Culture
media.summary: The race organizers and hosts discuss the unique self-supported 'Fat Ass' nature of the event, providing deep insights into the Florida Trail segments used and the wilderness environment.
media.contentSummary: This podcast episode features a discussion on the Two Prairies Ultra course layout and the community-driven 'Fat Ass' culture within the ultra running world.

media.title: The Legendary Lisa McFadden
media.summary: This episode features a discussion of the Two Prairies Ultra course and the unique challenges of running through the Florida wilderness.
media.contentSummary: Lisa McFadden joins the Where's The Finish podcast to discuss her finish at the Cowboy 200 and her experiences at iconic events like the Barkley Marathons and Western States.

media.title: YS100M? Where's the Finish?
media.summary: A crossover podcast episode featuring the organizers of the Two Prairies Ultra discussing the Florida trail running scene and the philosophy of 'Fat Ass' style racing.
media.contentSummary: Bob and KJ host a crossover podcast episode with Joe, Shae, and Kevin from the Whereâ€™s the Finish? podcast to discuss their experiences during the Badger race weekend.
